Brutally difficult but satisfyingly rewarding.  Don't Starve world is filled with monsters and environmental hazards that are trying their best to kill your character.  Surviving with other players is both fun and rewarding with all the shenanigans that you and your team will get into. Don't Starve Together has loot drops that you can earn or buy. All of them are just skins for exisitng items and characters and does not offer any advantage in-game wether you buy them or not. If you are new to the game, I suggest having a wikia open to help you with the crafting of items in the beginning of the game. The community is very helpful if you ever need help with what you need to do to survive and progess.  Don't Starve Together is a great game with a great art style and a rewarding progression system. Just need to get pass the difficult learning curve.

I have been aware of the Don't Starve series since its original release, yet I had never given any of the games a try until just this last month. The survival-crafting genre is probably one of my least favourite, though I have an extensive library of games related to it, but Don't Starve is one of the few I have played that genuinely gave me the "just one more day/night" mentality, something that I can't remember any other game of the genre doing for me. It has such a unique set of charming art, intuitive mechanics, challenging gameplay, and captivating air of discovery that make it an essential title to play. The multiplayer aspect of Don't Starve Together / The Forge only further extends the enjoyment and replayability of this game, as you get to share in the struggle and misery of the Don't Starve world with someone else, making for plenty of shenanigans. This game really was a pleasant surprise for me, and though it is an older series now it remains a refreshing experience even in 2018. I would give it a rating of 8.5/10, an absolutely essential gaming experience.

Bringing multiplayer to my all-time favourite survival game was one of the best ideas Klei ever had (besides making the original game in the first place). It retains the wonderfully weird, oddly bleak feel of the original game and slams it in with a bulk of new content and the ability to invite your friends to starve with you. And then you play as Willow and burn everything they make, because that's what multiplayer survival is all about: betrayal. At least, it is for me. But I'm getting off track. The point is that this game is the greatest multiplayer survival game I've ever played.  Music: 89% -- Some of the best, most unique music in a video game. Graphics: 92% -- A unique, unforgetable art style that is brilliantly drawn. Gameplay: 85% -- Excellent gameplay with great mechanics. Like insanity. And starving. Story: 73% -- The world of DST, like the original game, has some of the weirdest, most interesting lore I've seen. Difficulty: 80% -- I didn't rate it on balancing this time, because Don't Starve is meant to be hard, and this is. Enjoyment Factor: 92% -- Oh, it's so fun.  Overall: 85.16% -- The greatest multiplayer survival game, in my humble opinion.

Don't Starve Together is an even harsher environment than single player Don't Starve, but when you finally get people to play with you it's extremely rewarding. I've been putting it off for years from owning it because I couldn't get anyone to play with me, but it turns out the community is for the most part welcoming and friendly if you just hop in. I wish there were single player scaling (or any amount of player/party size scaling), but otherwise the additions from the base game are welcoming challenges that are fun and enjoyable and difficult as hell.

If you have friends that know what they are doing and have good internet or can host a stable server, it is fun. Playing on random servers can also be fun, but since progress gets deleted after like a day on some servers, it can feel like a waste of time. The events and new character updates that have been coming out make the gameplay a bit more refreshing.

So i think i have almost 200 hours in on the game. and i have about 150 in on dont starve. theyre both great games. if you love survival games and working with others to build and survive trhis game is for you. a lot of people pass this game off fbecause of its art style and say that makes it a bad game. which it doesn't. The art style is a nice twist in my opinion and i personally like it. if you dont then thats just your preference. The game its self is solid. you'll enjoy not knowing how to build anything and no tutorial or tips or what your even doing. its all a big learning experience by trial and error. which adds to the fun of the game and makes you feel accomplished when you figure things out. The crafting system is actually well done. though youre not told what does what the crafting is solid. every craftable item tells you exactly what items it takes to craft the item you want its just a matter of finding where and how to get the material needed.   The bad thing about dont starve together ive found is the community unfortunately. a lot of people are picky. if you set certain settings in your world and make some freinds while playing and they dont like it, theyll most likely get mad at you, tell you your trash and then unfriend you on steam. Most of the community hve been playing this game for some time and are not noob friendly people. I would reccomend making your own private server first and learning the ropes then after you learn some things make a public server or hop into one and lthen ask for tips from people. if you go into it knowing nothing people will get very mad.   other than that the game is great. for what it is id give it a 9 out of 10. its a definite buy if you like this style of game.

Bought this game to play with my brother thinking it would be a good deal but found it was an amazing deal when i realised you didnt need to buy two copies as it gave you a second one anyway.  On a laptop (not a high end gaming one) it didnt respond for a couple of minutes when loading the game, joining a game, or hosting a game. But, once it was loaded the game played flawlessly. Even on bad wifi, you can still play offline by playing LAN if you wish to play with others or if you want to play alone you could play in the middle of the sahara dessert if you wished.  The game does not push microtransactions upon the player, and microtransactions wont give players unfair advantages as they are purely cosmetic as far as i can tell.  Overall i would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys playing on public servers but i would really suggest gifting the second copy to someone you think would be interested because while it is more than entertaining playing online it is ten times better with friends.

[Introduction] Don't starve together (And Don't Starve) is hands down, one of the best games I have played. I've been with Don't starve since the beginning with early access, it was the second game I bought on steam so I've always loved this game. But this game is 100% worth 15$ it's fun with friend, or without. I do recomend going into this game blind, maybe watch a video that lets you understand some of the mechanics but try to go in unspoiled.  [Gameplay Overview] Don't Starve Together is a permadeath multiplayer game that has you balance between health, hunger, and sanity and trying to survive as long as possible aswell as acheiving goals. The gameplay is fun and challenging as you have to learn everything from experience, I remeber the first time playing don't starve game and knowing nothing about it, from the first [spoiler] hound attack,[/spoiler] all the way to fighting [spoiler]deerclops[/spoiler] it was horrifying but I learned from those expeirences and learned how to deal with them, this has been improved on in Don't Starve together as you can experience the game with friends! If you find the game too hard you can increase the ammount of food and resources and decrease the ammount of enemies as the world is fully customisable, you can increase the ammount of enemies to lots, or make the world always dark.   [Art Style] The art-style is one of the best I've ever seen, it captures the mood of the game so well and is beautifully animated serious props to Klei as the art-style is what seperates this game from all those other early access survival games.  [Pros] -This game has a great art style, and overhaul theme to it. As you slowly go insane you seen halucinations, hear voice, and slowly watch the world distort as you are plunged into darkness -The game is hard, which I like hard, I like a challenge other people may not like this but I personally love a challenge   [Cons] -Game can get boring without friends, but really depends on the person -Game can get repetitive after you play it for long periods of time   [Final Thoughts] This game has a tone of replayability as there is lots to explore, and even a workshop that has tons of content that includes character mods, new weapons, and even DLC's that have been ported from Don't Starve Standalone. I've gotten over 250 hours of enjoyment fo $15 I'd says a solid 10/10

Don't Starve Together is a great multiplayer game. Simply put, it is Don't Starve with all its DLC's in multiplayer. This game provides constant challenges for you to overcome, from the harshness of the different seasons, to the unique enemies and bosses to fight. It's pretty hard to ever feel like your not on the brink of failure. More people surviving does mean it's easier to collect resources, but food is king in this game and feeding more mouths keeps the game's challenge well alive. All together, you get a unique and difficult survival game with a great dark cartoony artstyle made better with your friends.

Well, putting aside the fact, that I have yet to get through winter...  I played this with a friend of mine and I need to say, that difficulty level (or perhaps, burden of knowledge necessary here) is sometimes through the roof. One bad move, one too brave attempt, one lacking ingredient... And you are done, just go and start again.  And you will - game is constantly getting polished, new events take place and it's usually fun. Usually, because X attempt at getting through X season might be getting... Overall it was a very positive experience and one that can be easily recommended.

To get to the point, I'd highly recommend Dont Starve Together to anyone who loves playing survival games with their friends  When I first got the original Dont Starve years ago, it was by far my favourite game I owned. Since I didn't have a steam account at that time, I purchased it on my brothers account. Once Klei released Dont starve together, I was hooked. It is updated a good amount of times a year, and has a unique artstyle I love. Dont Starve Together is a amazing survival game to play with your friends, and even supports mods to create your own experience. It has events every once in a while, to add some spice to the play style of the game. Even if you dont want to play co-op, there are many different options to change how you play including pvp to allow a more competitive playstyle. Dont Starve and Dont Starve together are an experience that I beleive most people would enjoy, and ever since Dont Starve Together was released in 2016, I am stilled not bored of it, and play it with all my friends.

A great game to spend time together with friends. Before you even realised, you may have spent hours in the game, enduring the different seasons with different kind of dangers. This game might looks simple, yet it requires you to learn and search for guides to actually live through the hardship which is why I suggest the game.

Compared to the regular Don't Starve the multiplayer version delivers a more challenging experience. Everyone needs to gather way more resources, communicate with each other and team up to withstand dangerous situations. A larger group has a better chance in defeating monsters but in the same time requires a lot more food to survive which balances the gameplay pretty well. All the characters have unique characteristics which can deliver huge benefits for the team or set them up for more trouble. For example Webbers spider nest can be a good source of silk and meat but after a few cycles there is a chance that it will spawn the Spider Queen. Everyone also gets a penalty in the form of a constant sanity drain if a member of the group died and is floating around as a ghost. The playerbase is usually friendly but if you join a server that is about to hit the winter season you will come across the rule of limited trust and might not get directions to the main base. This might sound a bit hostile but is just a little insurance against people who jump into a server and decide to destroy everything you and your team worked hard on. The best thing you can do is to gather some experience in single player, send the extra copy of Don't Starve Together to one of your Steam friends and jump with him / her into a private server. This way you will avoid trolls and in the same time learn about the new content that wasn't available in the classic game.

DST is a great time-consuming game, which is a compliment. It is very flexible and entertaining with unique style that will certainly get attention of new players. When you start, you want to know it all, and when you do, there is some event or update, so this adventure never ends. A wonderful world that does not burden you with quests, just an endless cycle of creating and exploring new things. It also requires a massive knowledge of game mechanics to survive and move on.  Playing with friends is a lot of fun because everyone can pick a grotesque version of themselves as their character.
honestly i had fun playing this game with friends but with workshop stuff the game gets pretty stale fast

Lots of challenging but fair fun! The game follows three simple mechanics of Hunger, Sanity and health that all need to be monitored and kept up. The game delivers a challenging start to new players but this can be counteracted with the ability to increase and decrease certain aspects of the game world such as being able to increase the amount of food drops to monsters. The game feels rewarding after learning how to kill a new monster or surviving a new season and finally getting past the last milestone that you and your friends. The game falls short on teaching the player new stuff but that only drives players to learn for them self without a set by set guide on how to play. Playing with groups of friends feels rewarding and safe but also brings the new problem of keeping everyone fed.   Over all I think the game is well worth the purchase as long as you have people to play with. If you don't I recommend playing the first game.

This game stands alone quite well, regardless of whether you're playing by yourself or with a friend you coerced into playing this game through constant pressure and the offer of a free copy. This game despite the lack of SW content provides what is in my opinion a much more robust version of RoG (and more) that truly provides a challenge to those playing alone or in a large group of inexperienced players. There is frankly a lot more to do in this game than even Don't Starve single player with RoG installed that is refreshing after playing over 150 hours of the other game feeling like you've run out of things to do unless you link to SW but that's a whole 'nother story. Don't starve is one of my favourite games of all time, and when the co-op came out, I got it basically right away. A lot of games I end up forgetting about and walking away, but dst isn't one of those. I can come back again and again, and still have as much fun as the time before each time. And if I get bored, the game continues to update and bring in special events and minigames. The community is also really good, and there are heaps of useful mods around that work in co-op mode perfectly. I've bought this game for numerous people, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a fun game to pass the time, or something to go all completionist on it and find everything. It's a great game and I think everyone could enjoy it for different reasons if they tried, and it's great fun playing with friends. I also really like the games artwork and unlimited possibilities. It's great fun, buy it.

If you like Don't Starve, and you have friends, get Don't Starve Together or you're wasting your life. Don't Starve works excellently as a singleplayer game but something about playing it with other people can make the game significantly more fun.  ATTENTION: DON'T MAKE THE MISTAKE OF THINKING THAT HAVING MORE PEOPLE WILL MAKE THE GAME EASIER It doesn't get easier and in fact gets to be much harder in many ways. Sure you can have two things being done at once, and fight together, but you also need to worry about 2 sanity meters, 2 hunger meters, 2 health meters, and getting both people equiped for fights as you can't just equip one person for a fight. Having more people means you get to do stuff faster but have equally more stuff to do. Also be careful as due to the fact that you are now going through materials faster you're going to be chopping a lot more trees down and the Keeper of the Forest will not like you for that.  This game gets an easy 9.5/10

Don't Starve Together is a sequel/expansion to Don't Starve. As such, it comes with lots of small improvements to the original game. However, having played both versions, the only real game-changing difference this iteration has is its titular multiplayer feature. It's a great game to play with friends, and it's brought countless hours of fun in both the gameplay itself and the interactions which occur as a result of it. However, this game lacks the adventure mode of the original, which makes the gamplay kind of repetitive and doesn't give players an end goal to work towards, which might iscourage some people. If you're okay with the Minecraft-esque objective of simply "stay alive and get good", this game has a similar approach to progression. Bottom line is, this is a good game, but it's not a substitute to the original Don't Starve experience. I prefer the original as far as gameplay goes, but if you have some friends who also like the game, the ability to play and interact with them is well worth the price of admission.

A very old school challenge, this game does not pull its punches with anyone.  In the easiest mode you and friends struggle for survival against starvation, heat, cold, and hostile creatures.  Truly a fitting man vs nature achitype.  However on argueably the hardest difficulty, not only do you have to survive nature, but also the players you may have once called allies.  An incredibly addicting game, and a dev team still dedicated to updating it, Don't Starve Together is worth its cost 3 times over.

I've loved the Don't Starve games since they first came out orignally in 2012. Since then, i've bought a copy of each, all I would recommend! Me and my friend both bought our own copies even if you can gift a friend it for free, more support to the devs, they clearly care about their work!   The Klei team as put so much love and effort into these games, the art style is unique and interesting, the gameplay lasts hours. Once Don't Starve Together came out, I needed to have it, and I finally do. I play tons with my close friend and it's become an often thing for us since we don't see each other much besides online. She was new to the game, and had never heard of Don't Starve, so I thought I'd introduce her too it. She loves it, and it runs smoothly on her (Trash, Potato, it's b a d) "computer". Both of us agree that it's a great game, the story is interesting, the art is wonderful, and whole game is honestly so different and fun. I'm normally nervous to play co-op games since I'm mostly bad at them, but for once i'm the player who teaches instead of dies constantly! The events are a new fun twist and are extremely challening but fun as well.  The point is, if you're looking for a new and unique, challenging experience with your friends, this is the game for you!  A little fun add on, we're addicted, we freak out whenever something new happens, you have no idea how loud the gasps of seeing a meese/geese land right next to us on the first day of spring were. Our little base is going well, besides almost burning it down... she has a great time yelling "BURN" with willow and then laughing like a mad man, as she plays as her (can't blame her). I honestly really don't like survival games. Never find them very fun. That being said, this game is awesome! Playing with friends is a blast, you aren't expected to have a wiki nearby to know how to make anything (all the recipes show you exactly what you need on a bar on the left), and dying is never as completely crushing as in other survival games. After playing 26 hours of this game with my friends, I took the plunge and just bought the singleplayer version to be able to play this great game on my own. The art style is so unique and charming, with a soundtrack that just matches everything perfectly, I don't see myself getting bored of this game anytime soon. Oh and it's got a very active and fantastic modding community too, constantly keeping things fresh and interesting!

Don't Starve Together the second installment to the Don't Starve Saga,  it’s a Wilderness based Survival game that is full of science and Magic. This is technically the multiplayer version of Don't Starve ROG  but with the updates over the years it has changed to its own game there is lots to look forward to in this game, and it is best played with friends There are tons of epic bosses to fight in Creative interesting mods the art style is very eerie and creepy giving a Tim Burton look there is quite a bit of lore put into the game giving the game pretty much a sequel to the first they're very fun events that let's us take a break from the Wilderness base Survival game such as the forge and Gorge which are exciting to play other events which are typically based around winter autumn and Chinese New Year are lot of fun, and add cool things to the game,  Skins are also a very fun part of the game giving the player something to actually work for something to collect the Developers put alot of work into the artwork for the skins and game itself seems the developers care a lot about this game as should any person who plays it I have been playing for 4 years if you are into survival games I definitely recommend this is the number 1# Survival game it has so much to do, And when playing as a job for everyone, it's a great way to make new friends and the game is constantly being updated with new content.   Rate:★★★★★

Don't Starve was the first game i have ever bought on Steam. Now when i look to this game i feel like everybody knows it, so its hard to explain the game but i will try my best.  Don't Starve is a game where you will try to survive and its not easy because everything in the world will try to kill you. You will fight monsters, try to manage your food so you don't starve later, collect materials to craft better gear and gadgets, and try to survive in harsh environments like winter season.   You will starve, you will freeze and a psycho deer cyclops will destroy your hard earned home but Don't Starve is good because of these challenges, at first you will fail but you will try different strategies and will learn at the end. If you still didn't try this game i suggest trying it, One of the best Co op games you will find on Steam.

I. Frickin. Love. Don't Starve Together. I actually played this before Don't Starve, and it has lead to me buying the original and its DLCs. I like these types of games where you work together for a common goal, and the characters available make the game completely different every time you play.

This is a spectacular game. I've played since beta. The only complaints I have is that the internet and ping at my house is terrible, and yet I can't play the events even solo without intense lag. This would be fine during last year's forge, which I didn't favor much, but this year is different. This year (2018) is the Gorge Event. I'd love a few things to change about the game that I will include in the following list. -Each event you get to pick a free character and all their items, but only one ( I'd really like Winnona, this event is her only skin of her's I like and I feel it would make the whole community feel more loved if they got to pick a free skin of their choice to be able to remember the event every time they played) - The event ( now that there is a leveling system) would be optional to play at anytime, without the chests for leveling, but still gaining xp, to show what events you've played and be a nice reward for a new system of all year, all events. - I know this is a lot, and I'm only a single person reviewing, but I really like the farming mechanic and the alternate ways for cooking and think you should add them to the hamlet dlc for the original game.   General Ideas ( not as important as the other recommendations) -add claiming territory in pvp servers - maybe make it so if you get a common item in a regular chest you get 2 or so, making the trade inn more of a common thing to use instead of just people buying commons hoping for a more rare item to sell back on the market. - Tree house villages would be cool - more amazing puns, I loved the Prime-Ape in SW - You should add a demo/Free trial version so more people can expierience the game -not sure if i spelled that right - You should add events where people submit fan art of each character and the most popular ones get added as skins   In general this is fantastic, it would be cool if you considered some of the ideas in my first recommendations, but all in all don't trouble yourselves too much, you have made such a great masterpiece and I would hate to pressure you to change it or stress any of you at Klei out, Have a nice rest of the summer and enjoy it while you can. Good Luck!! :)

Lots of fun.  The atmosphere in this game is quite unique and very well made.  While a lot of basic stuff (like crafting, some cooking recipies, gathering of Ressources like wood, stone, flint, ...) in the game is totally intuitive other things do require regular visits to a WIKI or some hardcore search-engine usage.  The characters all have their own advantages and disadvantages so they have to be played differently and I do recommend to use a mix of them when playing coop.   Don't Starve Together can be played alone, but the balancing has been adjusted for multiplayer although a collection of mods (for readjusting the balancing once more) can be used should you wish to play this version alone.  Fighting is easier for the host (especially against bosses) since latency issues can cause other players to recieve hits they would otherwise easily avoid. Avoiding hits is essential in boss fights so that can be quite a serious problem. Buuuut you might argue that bossfights are supposed to be difficult and they are still managable, even with that problem.   I love how many adjustable options there are for setting up a new world, like the abundance of Ressources, Enemy Spawnrates, Eventtimers, et cetera. New worlds can be made quite player-friendly for easy long time survival or extremely hostile for a bigger challenge and everything in between.

Best survival game.   Don't Starve Together is the "sequel" to Don't Starve, which is already an amazing game. Don't Starve Together has unique Tim Burton style graphics and completely unique from any other game. This has to be the best survival game out there for a lot of reasons, but the main reasons are its ability to keep you going. You can't just stand around; you have to keep moving, collecting resources and food, and preparing for Winter if it's Autumn. To continue on, it becomes addicting and challenging real fast. Some people say this game is awful and one of the reasons is that there is no tutorial. Well, guess what bucko? Minecraft doesn't have a tutorial either. Tutorials aren't always necessary. Last, of all, the game has a combat system of prediction and strategy. Each monster and animal have their own way of defeating them which makes combat different for each thing you fight. You noticed the "Together" in Don't Starve Together right? Well, this game is multiplayer, meaning you can play singleplayer or private multiplayer with friends, or go on a public server alone or with friends. You need a lot of practice with the game and it's not easy for newbies, but once you learn via online or friends who are already great at the game, you'll find that Don't Starve Together is a great mix of survival and fun.

After 50 hours of gameplay i think i am ready to give a review for this game,  First of all i need to say the graphics and the gameplay are extremely beautiful and unique. The difficulty of this game is nice too, its very hard in the beginning and later when you learn the basics of this game you will find stuff much easier. graphics 9.5/10  The events are very good thing to spend time on, it requires time, speed and teamwork to achieve the best results. For now i am playing "The Gorge" Event and i need to say it is very hard but i love it! You never get bored by the content of the game because there is a lot of stuff you can learn. I hardly learned anything without the FanWIKI of DST, the game doesnt explain you the mechanics or has any tutorial for you. It just throws you in the wilderness and you need to find out how to survive. It can take you many games until you know what to do. Content 9/10  The multiplayer is very fun, you can play with your friends and join a server with up to 64 people! You can adjust the server with everything e.g How many mobs spawn,how long is a season,how big is the map etc. You can also add mobs to make your gameplay much easier like health bars, map huds and many more! I actually played this game for 4-5 days straight without getting bored. Fun 9/10  And the last thing is the price, i believe that the price is very good and if its on sale...well you gotta buy it 100% . Also you dont need to buy Dont starve and dont starve together cause the single player version comes with multiplayer (unless buying for a friend too). Price 9/10  I believe this game is totally worth it if your are a fan of survival games with hard difficulty, i've been looking for this kind of game for ages and i dont regret the price that i payed for. the price is totally equal with the content  Avarage Mark: 9.5/10 - Matt Approves

It's a Lovely Game!  1) Good for people that love challanges.This game will put everything that you have to the test. 2) A lot of cosmetics and vanity items, that will make you stand out. ( you can equip the unlocked clothing on any character you want, there are no restrictions). 3) Don't worry if you don't have somebody specific to fill in the "Together" part of the game; there are otions for you both host and join other players game. 4) Very rewarding and interesting Events that add new content to the game. 5) You get 4 "Gift Boxes" that you can exchange in survival mode for cosmetics and vanity items; this limit recharges weekly (there is no such limit for Event Chests). Don't Starve Together is an absolutely amazing game to play alone or with friends. With all the survival co-op games that are flooding the market, Don't Starve give a nice fresh breath of air to the genre. The game runs very well even on lower-end computers due to the art style and general design of the game. Below are some key qualities that make me love this game.  [h1][b]Random world generation[/b][/h1]  Every time you start a new game, the world will be randomly generated. You can edit the settings on how the world should be and what it should feature (see next point regarding this). This results in every world being unique and you can experiment with different play styles.  [h1][b]Customizable world[/b][/h1]  There is an absolutely amazing modding comunity for Don't Starve Together, but more importantly, every world you start is fully customizable in what it should feature. Here you can specify if there should be more of a type of creature, like rabbits, for example, to be able to gather more food, or less of a type of monster, like less or no hound attacks if you are struggling to survive. You can also adjust what season you start at, how long the days or nights are, the frequency of thunderstorms and many more.  [h1][b]Unique setting and eerie atmosphere[/b][/h1]  As mentioned earlier, the art style is very different to what we have nowadays with games. The story and setting of the game are shrouded in mystery and new-comers to the game will be scared of the monsters and how to fight them. The game mechanics of the darkness, sanity and seasons are fun ways of forcing the player to always do something and not just hide in a base and try to survive. You must be proactive in this game and learn to utilize the different resources, creatures and more importantly, sanity.  [h1][b]Free events[/b][/h1]  Right now The Gorge event is running which came completely free to the owners of the game. This is my first event and it is fun. It feels as a sort of 'big' mini-game, where you play in a completely different setting with other mechanics as the main game, keeping things fresh and giving the players opportunities to get new and wonderful cosmetics.  [h1][b]Conclussion[/b][/h1]  I haven't played this game for as long as I have wanted to, but it is an absolute blast to play. Every world feels unique and it is fun to always try new ways of playing. Definitely get this game, it is worth it for the full price which isn't that expensive anyways!

Hi people. This review is dedicated to Don't Starve Together. In this game I've been playing for more than 200 hours, and what can I say about this game? This is a multiplayer with unusual graphics and gameplay. After a few hours of playing, you will understand that everything is not so simple, today you are going to chop down a tree, tomorrow the tree is chopping you off. This game is designed to play with friends, because if you decide to go to the server, you will understand that there are either noobs or players who in every way want to spoil the game. So it's better to play with a good company. Personally, it's difficult for me to play with my friends, because they often like to have fun, because of this all problems turn into laughter, and later into the death of the whole team. I hope you are luckier than me. Have a good game, and a little luck!!!

However, with an old guy's leading, the learning process would be wonderful.  The community includes large number of mods, which provide high quality experiece. An open world makes more people to join in. No matter who you are, whether you are an architect or an exploer, you will definitely get satisfied. A typical game for all ages !  Peculiar paintings attract me ! Of course, you can play this with your GF (by the way you should have a GF). Can solve the problem in long-distance relationship !!!

Ive met some great people on this game, some pretty horrible people to. Ive traveled to the depths of every cave, slain every boss, made hundreds of bases, killed thousands of things, including other players. Yet I still find a way to get up to some antics on every server. Ever tried raising a beefallo in the middle of the summer with extremly low resources? Ever destroyed an entire server by spawning in a million tentacles with magical books? Ever hatched thirty tallbird eggs and then watching them all fight to the death? You can go on a server and eat food, do some emotes, make some tools and plant some grass. But thats not capturing the spirit of the game, were together damnit. You can get a crowd of people to all fight a giant bug in the middle of the desert, you can discover an ancient civilization underground and fight a giant skeleton monster. You can forge giant megabases that span entire biomes. With more people you can do whatever you want in this game twice as fast, and make it twice as fun. And if your bored just hop on a server and burn down the main base or something I dont really care. 10/10, dont forget all the events and stuff to!

first off, to get this out of the way, the only thing that I dislike about this game is the death/respawn system.   other than that, it's fun (more fun with friends obviously).    you feel rewarded by experimenting and exploring.   setting up a base camp is quite fun.  trying to dodge bees, tree monsters, ravenous dogs, and mad beefalo while gathering materials...not quite as fun.   the enemies are super unforgiving and hyper aggressive when you di*k with them.  and sometimes you dont even have to do that.  theyre just there....waiting...watching...lurking amoungst the shadows.   but again, the death system is more of a pain/punishment than anything in MP.  and in a world like DST's world...you will die in some bullsh*t ways...leaving you angerily muttering, "are you fuc*ing serious".  when you do die, get ready to become a major burden on everyones shoulders if youre playing with others.  o and while youre waiting, you can float around as a ghost being a constant reminder to your friends that you suck.

Surviving through the winter is really tough unless you know your poop. And lastly, the atmosphere, music and dev's sense of humor is tight af  (Red butts xD ). A true survival game through and through, no complaints from me or me friends after 10 hrs of playing it except 'WHY DA FOCK IS THIS GAME SO 'ARD!?!"  Props Klei, it was a real treat shooting up this batch.

Don't Starve Together is a Co-Op (or singleplayer) Survival (Horror/Cartoon) game entirely based around the theme of being dropped somewhere in the wilderness and having to survive on the environment around you. It uses the theme of "horror" well by incorporating it into the gameplay using insanity and the use of fire at nighttime, while the cartoon element takes out some of the "horror" aspect to make it much more spooky and playable for a larger player-base. That being said, the gameplay is really quite fun and fast-paced, making it so that you have to think about what you want to do next given that you only have so much time in each day. Each playable character has different perks, making each new world a new game and challenge for you to play. Especially fun with friends! I highly recommend getting this game! Plus you get a copy to give a friend--who needs a sale!

I cannot recommend this game enough to anyone who is currently on the fence about buying it. After having spent close to 300 hours playing this game, I have yet to become bored with the gameplay, due in part to the wonderful job Klei is doing with special events, as well as the mods made by fellow players.  If you have enjoyed Don't Starve, you will highly enjoy this game, as it expands on the content found in the first game. If you haven't played Don't Starve, well, I really don't know what to say. Just go play it, then come back here. Now on to the things I really like. First, the art style. This game does an amazing job of making everything look whimsical, yet still somewhat threatening. Second, the game does not hold your hand or tell you what you should do next, nor does it explictly say what creatures will kill you. Third, this game can be brutal. If you and your friends die with no way to resurect, than that's it. You will have to start over in a new world from scratch. Can it be frustrating and rage inducing at times? Yes. Will you find yourself dying due to stupid mistakes? Yes. But over time and with enough patience, you will learn from your mistakes and become a better player due to your failures. Trust me, it feels really good to finally kill a boss after dying from it several times and being forced to start from scratch again and again. Furthermore, Klei has done a tremendous job of adding updates to the game to keep it fun, i.e The Forge. Overall, this is an amazing game, and I highly recomend it to anyone who likes survival/crafting games, or is simply looking for a challenge.  Nominated for the Steam Awards

This is a very great game, I would reccromend to play with family and friends (that is if you have any).  A terrific game that allows easy to find mods to install that make the game easier, harder, more chalenging, or more cheaty.  Whatever you want.  Now I must say the artwork is absolutely fan-flippin-tastic.  Love the fact that the characters' voices are replaced with instrument sounds instead of real voices.  The gameplay is fun, learning how to do specifc things and discovering new things constantly as well with enemies and tools and crafts.  Not to mention how interesting it is how the characters all ended up in the area.  I rate the game 9/10.  Only thing missing that would make the game more challenging and difficult, as well as harder than focusing on food, would be adding a water meter.  Would pay for a DLC adding that.

This game is the best. The morbid but charming animations and dialogue make all of the characters and NPC's lovable. Meanwhile, the game offers seemingly infinite different approaches to take in order to survive, with so many subtle mechanics that you could spend months just learning about all there is to do in-game.   The unlockables are great, with playtime rewarded with random drops of varying rarity, and special items that come around with each new seasonal event. I love this game and would recommend it to anyone, but especially to those who are looking for a solid, enjoyable multiplayer game to share with friends.   It doesn't hurt that you get a free copy of the game to gift to a friend, just make sure you pick a friend that'll actually use it. Learn from my mistakes. Hahaha

This game is worth the money. Your getting 2 copies of an amazing quality game, which means that you could get one copy for $7.49 USD which is an amazing price.   Don't Starve Together is a really great expansion on the original Don't Starve, but manages to still be amazing even when it has some tiny sacrifices to make this game multiplayer. This game runs really smooth, and handles very well. The controls are easy to get used to which makes this a great game if you want to play it non stop. This game also generates a completely different world every time you get bored of your other worlds, and can be customized, so that only your friends can join, or can be a fully public server.  I can proudly say that I recommend this game to anyone who wished to give this game a go. 10/10

I've owned this game for years and have pumped over 100 hours into DST and the singleplayer and still haven't reviewed it, for shame.  Highly recommended, I'll sing this games praises whenever I get the chance. It's provided hours of entertainment, solo and with friends. The first time I became totally self sustainable I was so pleased with myself, and then promptly died to Deerclops (beware winter!). I'm not sure what it is about Don't Starve, but I find myself itching to play it every few weeks and then will end u playing it for two days and barely doing anything else. It's been a favorite passtime for me and a couple friends in recent months, cooperating and getting each other killed has been a riot.  Friendly enough for beginners without holding a veterans hand and putting the kiddiemitts on, I recommend this for anyone looking for a good game that they can leave and come back to, or play for hours on end.

It's a great survival game. Mods are great fo fix quality of life things that klei dont want to change (which is fine). The only thing I have noticed that bugs me a bit after 250 hrs is that certain characters are much better than others. I feel like a little tweaking has been in order for a while now. Other than that I was very happy with all of the regular updates to the game and the Forge was a lot of fun.  Update: For people with questions about this game in 2019. It is a great time to give this game a try if you've been on the fence about it. Klei's road map for DST in 2019 is very promising. New characters and re-works for current characters that need it are finally coming. Klei has also promised new content outside of characters and character changes. New biomes are set to come out a little later this year.   Why start now if the content isn't out yet? DST has a decent learning curve and getting an early start should put you in a good place to be comfortable with the game as the content drops month by month.

I love this so much! it has become almost a weekly ritual for me and my friends. You can adjust the difficulty as much as you want by tweaking the number of resources and enemies.  It's fun slowly constructing the best/funnest strategy for survival, but the game is almost always capable of throwing a curve ball at even the experienced players. The modding community is great, as well as the official events that keep the play just the right kind of varied. It also has a pretty good sense of humor, provided you have the time to read the item description. Trying to find random random players to play with is a bit of a coin flip, but I have also met some wonderful people that are great to play with.

I've played this game for a bit, and i absolutely adore it. From anything to the amazing events that happen every now and then (**coughcoughbringbacktheforgecoughcough**,) to just having playing with friends (Or just arguing,) everything is lotsa fun.  Pros: -Alot to do, Lots of great characters. (WES IS BEST.) -Great way to test your friendship. -Great way to lose friends. -Overall a great community. -Endless replay value. -So many possibilities with world generation, mods, etc. -Overall just an amazing game.  Cons: -Can be a little glitchy at times, a few bugs here and there but its pretty much fine. -Wish there were a few more debug commands. -Connection can sometimes be... frustrating...  Well, thats about it, overall, its worth the price, its a great game honestly and probably my overall favourite of all time. I'd give it a 9.8/10, definitely would reccomend it to anyone. When they say "Don't starve" they REALLY mean DON'T STARVE. It took so many deaths and restarting worlds to even figure out a fraction of what we were supposed to be doing. And even though you end up yelling back and forth with your friends about who keeps eating all the jerky, it's still a ton of fun. But I highly suggest doing a crash course with tutorials on Youtube if you want to progress a little easier and pick up some good tips.

Just so y'all know, you can in fact run this game on a computer with only 2GB of RAM. I didn't realize that 4GB was the stated minimum requirement until I was looking at the store page for a different reason and realized I'd been playing for months on a supposedly inadequate laptop.

If you love Don't Starve, and have 5 friends that also love Don't Starve. Then I highly recommend playing Don't Starve Together. It's a great way to see how well your friends and yourself will last together. With more people come more challenges as food is scarce and resources can be hard to gather. Like normal Don't Starve, you are able to adjust the worlds to better suit your needs.  Beware as Giants roam the lands, and caves hold unknown terrors.  The only issue with Don't Starve Together is the fact that Caves require their own server, meaning that whoever is hosting has to have an ok PC to host both the above ground and Caves servers. Also having a strong internet connection is recommended if you have more than 3 people on at a time.  The story essentially takes place after Winston beats Maxwell and assumes the chair, though that is really a minor detail. It's yet to add Shipwreck, though Klei has been slowly adding all of the DLCs from Don't Starve into it.

This is one of my favorite games of all time.  Few games match the charm and lovely, whimsical appeal of Don't Starve. But, visual uniqueness aside, Don't Starve is a deceptively deep survival game. You will likely die many times, but after each death you learn something new, and you will take that knowledge with you into the next world. Eventually, there will come a point where you have such a thorough understanding of the many different gameplay elements of the game that death will seem like some distant memory.   Indeed, once you've established a consistent means of obtaining food, and have fortified your base heavily enough, there will be little to threaten your survival. At which point, the game will evolve and you'll be able to enjoy the deeper layers of crafting and the challenges of obtaining that unique new item or weapon. And, if you've reached a point, like me, where you seem to have obtained everything you will ever need... And have no threats to your survival... You can just play the game in your off time to relax. There is something reallly therapeutic about this game.   From the moment I started playing the single player game, 'Don't Starve', I was hooked. I played that for hours and hours, and was reluctant to dive into 'Don't Starve Together' as I had assumed it was a multiplayer focused game, intended only for those that played with others. But I am here to tell you, I was wrong.  By all means, it's a fantastic game to play with friends. I played with my brother for a short while and I have to say, I enjoyed it a lot. The challenge of survival, of needing to obtain enough food to survive the night, was heightened with two mouths needing to be fed. However, just like in the original Don't Starve, this game is a joy to play alone, too.  So, please don't let the title fool you. Sure, it's a fantastic multiplayer game. But I have played many, many hours and am still living on the first world I created - day 400 something. All by myself.  What's more, the developers clearly have a great passion for this unique world they have created. They continually update the game, and have begun implementing entire new game modes to allow players to experience a whole new aspect of 'Don't Starve'. The Forge was an absolute blast and I eagerly await its return, and the arrival of new multiplayer experiences.  So, please, do yourself a favour. If you enjoy survival games, you owe it to yourself to check out Don't Starve.

A wonderful survival simulator that becomes exceptional when played with friends. It's open to mod support (but this can make the game unstable) which allows for even more end game content. While none of the systems are terribly deep, there's a lot here to keep you busy for 10's of hours. I've seen most of what the game has to offer in my 66 hours of co-op fun, but a close friend of mine has 500+ hours in the game. Want to get lost in the woods, cut down trees, mine rocks, build a base, plant a garden, and explore some caves with a friend in a charming and challenging world? This is your ticket.

I think it's worth your money, if you have a few friends that are down to play with you then definitely buy it, even if you get bored after a while you'll want to play again, this game has its own charm.

first death to darkness. second death to starvation. third death to hounds. 11/10 would die again. super fun. :)  pros: - great and unique aesthetics - non-linear paths to "survival" - replayable due to random map generation - TONS of mini collectibles for skins and hats on your characters - multiplayer with friends you know in the same room is x100 times better (the shouting ahha) - outside of the regular survival mode, there was a limited time arena (called the Forge) mode, so semi-active development - active modding community to always enhance - EASY way to set up own servers/dedicated servers for friends, custom mods, etc.  cons: - mediumish learning curve AKA u will die and rage quit a bit - after a while, the "optimal" starting strat is figured out, so you tend to do the same thing -> kinda grindy/boring - no content expansion for the survival portion - once u go multiplayer, very hard to go back to single AKA u kinda need friends to play - NO ACHIEVEMENTSSSSSSS  notes: - about 60% of online communities are not from the USA, large Chinese population (not good or bad, just if u cant speak the language, sorta hard to interact)  verdict: would heavily recommend this game to friends unless they specifically hate survival games. 200+ hours into this game and im STILL learning new things!

Ok, after so many hours, I don't need to say that I love this game. First, It works on old computers, and some people like me knows how we want that. Second, You can play this game alone or multiplayer. It has events and even more features than the base game with reign of giants. But what I can really say to sell this game to you is that, FOR ME, It's a game that enter in the state of art. Not only It is difficult as It is beautiful. Although You will be running around searching for supplies for surviving, If you stop a little, you will start to see a World that is alive, that have been well thought and that is against you. And then, bang, you died. The next time you get the grip of the game, bang, you died again. I can say that Now I think I understand the concepts of It pretty well, so, bang, I died again. Frustating? Yes. Rewarding? Yes. To lose is part of the game, but when you strive, when you overcome your last faliure and you deserve, It is one of the best moments. Sometimes is for luck, and sometimes you just learned how to not starve.

I hope this was helpful. Have fun not starving!

This game is one I keep coming back to time and time again. It's survival meets Tim Burton, and I couldn't love it more. The community isn't half as bad as normal online communities, and you can always just play with your friends.

The game is great, loads of fun with friends, even then, you can hop online with strangers, and still comunicate! I never played the original Don't Starve, and I honestly don't have the full intention to do so yet, this game can be a challenge, together, or alone! It is greatly reccomended to players who like a bit of challenge, hang out with friends, or simply just want to see how quickly they screw everyone over! Either way, this game is really fun, especially once you get the hang of it!  [u] What I like [/u] -Challenging -No real tutorial, you're thrown in and that's it -Option to play alone -No friends needed -Cooperative -Art Style -Events -Make the game a living hell for everyone else  [u] What I think could be used to improve the game [/u] -The ability to turn off events (unless you already can) -The ability to activate past events (Like The Forge, new players like me really wanted to experience that!)

This is one of our all time favorite games to play as a family and even stands as a close second to Minecraft survival. In total, we have played it for 1,500+ hours and have never actually joined a community. It has been just us and the kids (three computers) starting world after world. (shout out to my older sister whom we recently got addicted to this game.) The customization in this game is astounding even without the incredible selection of user created mods. The devs are still active even thought they are also working on Oxygen Not Included. When we got this game, we were concerned that it would be too scary for the kids who were very little at the time. We were thrilled to discover that you can remove or avoid almost everything that might bother them. The only notable exceptions being the shadow creatures when you go insane (there is a command you can enter that increases your sanity (check the wiki)) and the ghost when you die.

- Year of the Dog Event - Older brother and I decide to play game - We eventually settled into an area  - Added machines and flooring and whatnot - Found fancy decorations like carpets, a few large marble sculptures (that we dragged around for miles), and some trinkets from scavenging and *cough*graverobbing*cough* - I notice a recipe for a dog shrine - Thought it'd be neat, already had a bit of gold - Tread for miles to find the last few gold nuggets needed - Finally crafted it - We set it down and then wonder what it even does - I suggested using a torch in some way, thought it was like a torch holder - Brother is holding torch - He quietly suggests to himself:  "...Light it?"  - Then immediately sets it on fire - Setting the carpet on fire - Setting the machines and trinkets on fire - The entire camp is aflame - We suffer huge casualties  DST: The game where a simple question will burn down your home.

UPDATE: This review is severially outdated and it will not be correct. Sorry for this inconvience.    When I first got my key, I got really exicted, To the point where I've gotten over 400+ Days on a world w/ my friends. Here are some of the basic things you should keep in mind about while playing with your friends.  Starting off: Once you start off you have 3 choices or gamemodes to play with your friends, Survival, Wilderness and Endless  Survival: Basically same twist as if you payed endless just if everyone on the server is Dead, a counter goes down for someone to join (That is alive) or the whole world gets reset with the same generation presets.  Wilderness: When you join the server you spawn in a random location (Sometimes an island if your unlucky) and you need to find your group to set up camp. Once you die or have died you are taken to the change character screen and respawn in a new location with your camera rotated in a different pos and if you look on your map there will be a small circle on where you've last died. Keep in mind you die again that Circle updates to where you last died so try to get back to your stuff without dying.  Endless: Ah, my favorite of all the gamemodes. When you join the server you spawn in from a "Jury-Rigged Portal" And begin surviving. If you die you become a ghost with the character traits of your character. You can respawn if you haunt one of the following. (Meat Effigy, Life giving amulet, Touch stone, Jury rigged portal and Tale-Tell heart) If you respawn from the "Jury-Rigged Portal or Tale-Tell heart" You will lose around 20 MAX Health Points. You can get those lost hit points back from getting a booster shot which requires 3 Papyrus, 2 Healing Salves and 1 Stinger (YES STINGERS FINALLY HAVE A USE)  Once you join the server (Depending on the size / max amount of players) You basically play regular Don't Starve, If join a larger server with more people there's a silm chance that you will be able to survive the up coming winter or Night. Which can be difficult depending if PVP is on or not. And Since armor has now been changed to take Less damage i.e Wood Armor = 80% (Reg ds) 60% (Dst) Marble = 95% (Reg Ds) 80% (Dst) Football helm = 80% (Reg dst) 60% (Dst).  Characters -  Wilson:  Pros -  Grows a beard  Cons - None.  Wilson is a character that i'm pretty sure everyone is going to see ALOT of since he's the first character and Really has no Downfalls even though it takes 19 days for Wilson to get his Homeless man beard it will protect you in winter.  Willow:  Pros -  Doesn't Take fire damage Starts with a lighter (Infinte torch)  Cons -  When on low sanity Will cause lots of forest fires Can Grief other players Flamable walls / Crops.  Willow is a good character for surviving the Winter and helping out your friends in DST. But she can be used to be the most annoying person in the entire server. She can run around starting massive forest fires and buring down vauable resources as well as causing LOTS of lag.  Wolfgang:  Pros -  Gets stronger on a full stomach Has more hp  Cons -   1.5x the faster Hunger drain at full stomach Moves and deals less damage at a smaller stomach Loses more sanity in Night / Afternoon  Ah, Wolfgang more of a fighter than a gardener. Wolfgang can be useful for tanking spiders nest and killing of those annoying Tall birds and getting there eggs the only downfall is If you have a lot of food toghether It's not going to last very long amongest 6 Players, If you are playing as wolf gang only "Power up" to full stomach when in need. Don't just waste food to be a full stomache because food WILL be eaten fast.  Wendy:  Pros -  Has a ghost sister Doesn't lose much sanity in dark  Cons -  Does -.25% Less damage than all characters Loses 50 Sanity when spawning abigail in  Wendy is one of my personal favorite characters just to add a little challange to the game. Even though she doesn't hit hard she losses NO Sanity in the Afternoon. As well she can spawn her sister in after 2 - 4 Days by killing ANY Animal / Creature Near the flower. She will lose 50 sanity for spawning he in even if another player kills something near the flower. But the fun part is Abigail does Splash damage to mobs near her. If you need to fight something send abigail (or your friends) to kill it. If abilgail dies go pick her flower up, If you can't find it theres a minimap icon for it.  WX78:  Pros -   Can eat ANY Food that is spoiled / Stale and take no penalty. Can be charged by lightning Can eat gears to level up (Max 400 hp, 200 Hunger, 300 Sanity) Also gears give health, hunger and sanity back if eaten.  Cons -  Takes Damage in the rain Starts with low stats (100 hp, 100 hunger, 100 Sanity)  WX78 Is a good character if you can get to a supply of gears fast as well your going to need to hunt down a pig village for an umbrella. If you don't get an umbrealla right off the bat you will loss 0.25 of 1 Hp every 3 - 5 Seconds. If your lucky enough and you make an umbrealla you won't have the chance of being struck by lightning which will cause you too lose 33 Sanity but Not freeze during winter and can glow like a torch the effect only lasts for one day so don't be adventuring in the middle of the night if the Radius of light is shrinking. But can be benifical if you use if effectively.  Wickerbottom:  Pro -  Starts off with all science machine reciepes unlocked. Able to craft her own books Starts off with 2 Papyrus.  Cons -  Can't Sleep Takes more penalty for eating Spoiled or Stale food  Wickerbottom, The walking science machine, You can pretty much help your friends by going right to an achlemy engine instead of wasting the time of making an Science machine. Even though you can't Sleep there are multiple ways of getting your sanity back up. With the abiliy to make your own books you have the power to instantly grow all crows and Plants, Spawn lots of birds and more for the cost of your sanity. And yes I know this sounds like wickerbottom is a bad character, as long as you know how to get sanity back without murdering the flower population.  The Rest of the characters have no been added while writing this review.  Over all this is a great game and I recommend it to any and all players.  EDIT: YOU DON'T NEED DON'T STARVE TO PLAY THIS YOU JUST NEED A DON'T STARVE TOGHETHER KEY. PLEASE STOP ADDING ME

After achieving a good ammount of hours and experience playing this game, I thought it was a good time to update my review.  Don't Starve Together, or DST, continues to be a lovable mess that is extremely enjoyable and endearing to play.  A survival game at its core, it is challenging enough to make certain players to starve to death without proper care and knowledge on how it can be survivable and joyfull. It is a harsh learning curve and always a challenge from the start, which makes it highly replayable.  Further supporting "replayability" are the characters present in the game, which, hold the game together by their diferent atributes, perks and flaws. Making the game easy in some aspects, however, hard on others.  Has a final point that I personally love about the game is the artwork itself. It is unique in its approach and portraits uniquely the gray area between insanity and sanity, from vibrant colors to shadowy and dark colors that can terrorize in your nightmares.  Be ready for a thrilling adventure.

This game is amazing.  I mostly play Don't Starve and not Don't Starve Together, but from my short experience with this specific version, I can say that it is just as good as the original. The graphics are unique and interesting, yet also high quality. The monsters and characters are all unique. Each character has pros and cons and are balanced.  My only issue with it is that some of the bosses are far harder than they should be. As in, they have way more health than they really should; the Dragonfly, who was already hard to defeat, now has 27000 health, which is overdoing it in my opinion. The Toadstool has even more health and doesn't even have half-decent drops. However other bosses like the bearger, deerclops and moose/goose are balanced.  However, I very much enjoyed playing it with my sister.  Overall, this is a great game and I would definitely recommend it.

This is the only survival game you will need. Survival at its finest.   The art style deserves a special mention as it is one of its kind.  The gameplay is really deep and has so many layers of options and choices. This game is for the people who are looking ultimate and hardcore survival. It is unforgiving and you will die over and over again. It has a random map generation sytem and different biomes to venture on.  There are different seasons, each with its own characteristics. It has different types of npc character, enemies, bosses each with their own weak points.  The different items and tools you will need to survive is countless. It is a simple game, easy to hop onto but difficult to master.  oh and there are also different characters to choose from with their own attributes wnd also different game modes to choose from.  You can also play it alone, doesn't always have to be co-op.  The game is frequently updated and supported by the dev and community.   Totally recommended.

[h1] Don't Starve Together is a super fun co-op survival game that offers a lot of replayability and depth [/h1]   A 2D, cartoony, isometric game that offers so much to do in terms of content, gameplay, replayability (randomly generated maps) and [b] teamwork! [/b]   I think [i] Don't Starve Together [/i] might be one of the best survival games in the past decade...  you can tell a lot has been put into this indie game and the devs update it REGULARLY!   [h1] Gameplay [/h1]   So you can begin your game by picking a cast of some pretty unique playable characters with their own little 'perks' or 'starting items/equipment' that can synergize well with each other (early game/later game).  But if it's your first time, [b] just pick whoever you think LOOKS COOL/INTERESTING! [/b]  [i] It does start off slow, but the more time you put into it, the more rewarding it is! [/i]   You'll then start of your adventure by spawning in a random location on the map.  After that, it's all up to you to [i] collect, gather, cook and kill [/i] and do whatever it takes to survive!    [i] If you get really confused or just don't know what to do, there are always guides and the Don't Starve Wiki! [/i]   You can unlock some [b] cool cosmetic skins [/b] just by playing or you can buy it from the Steam Market/in-game store!   - Although I haven't played much Solo, I thoroughly enjoy my time playing it [b] with friends [/b] - as most people would recommend doing so too!    [h1] Performance [/h1]   - In terms of PC requirements, you can pretty much run this game on any computer without needing a next-gen graphics card. I have played it on my potato 2013 laptop with Integrated graphics and it runs pretty well!   [b] HOWEVER, hosting a server will take some resources from your computer, so if you have a potatoaster PC, I suggest letting someone else host! [/b]  - There are a [i] few lag/ping spikes [/i] when playing multiplayer, however, but as long as you have a decent internet connection you should be fine.  Overall, the game does run fairly well/smooth FPS-wise.   [h1] Graphics/Visual Style [/h1]   - This game has a very distinct, artistic visual style that seems so [b] fitting [/b]. It has a cast of very whacky/funny, whimsical characters that gives off a very [i] Alice in Wonderland/Tim Burton [/i] feel to it. I personally LOVE IT and is one of my favorite things about this game!   [b] AUDIO - SOUND EFFECTS: [/b]  Again, a lot of the things sound very quirky and has a lot of personality in it.  From gathering grass to your character talking - it is very imaginative yet distinct so you know know what's happening.   All in all, you can tell it doesn't take stuff [b] too [/b] seriously and there are some funny/quirky/cute things that are quite cheesy.  Although there is an underlying darker theme (the Darkness, starvation, survival) in terms of the characters' lore/backstory.   -   I cannot stress enough how fun it is to play with friends/other players, as you need a lot of micro-management, resource management and teamwork/communication to survive for a long time.  Of course, a lot of the resources that spawn are dependent on [b] RNG [/b], but [b] THAT'S WHAT MAKES THE GAME FUN/CHALLENGING! [/b]  Good job, Klei!  This game is worth every penny and I hope you guys have a blast.
